xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric

Class EmpiricalCDF

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.functions.AbstractFunction<Number,Double>
      • xxl.core.math.functions.AbstractRealFunctionFunction
        • xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.EmpiricalCDF
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Function<Number,Double>, RealFunction, WindowQuery

    public class EmpiricalCDF
extends AbstractRealFunctionFunction
implements WindowQuery
    This class realizes a real-valued function providing an empirical cdf (cumulative distribution function) based on a simple random sample (iid) for data given by objects of type Number.
    The empirical distribution function F_n(y) of a sample is the proportion of observations less than or equal to y.
    Generally, a more detailed coverage of the empirical cdf is given in [Sco92]: David W. Scott. Multivariate Density Estimation: Theory, Practice, and Visualization. 1992.
    The cdf is implemented as a one-dimensional function expecting objects of type Number as well as a RealFunction expecting data of type double. A sample of any kind of data given by an iterator could be easily obtained through the reservoir sampler cursor.
    See Also:
    Function, AbstractRealFunctionFunction, RealFunction, WindowQuery, Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • FACTORY

        public static Function FACTORY
        Provides a factory for a sampling based cdf estimator. The parameters needed for construction are passed to the factory by an Object[] representing an iid sample.

      • epsilon

        public double epsilon()
               throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns the current confidence interval at the last computed function point with P( | Fn(x) - F(x) | < epsilon ) = 1 - alpha = p.
        Note:<\b> This functionality is not available yet!
        Returns:
        value of the current confidence interval given by [ F(x)-epsilon, F(x)+epsilon]
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if no confidence level alpha has been given and hence no confidence interval for the given value could be computed or a sample of a size smaller than 40 is given

      • epsilon

        public double epsilon(double x)
               throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns the current confidence interval at the given value x with P( | Fn(x) - F(x) | < epsilon ) = 1 - alpha = p.
        Parameters:
        x - argument where to evaluate the confidence interval
        Returns:
        value of the current confidence interval given by [ F(x)-epsilon, F(x)+epsilon]
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if no confidence level alpha has been given and hence no confidence interval for the given value could be computed or a sample of a smaller size than 40 is given

      • confidence

        public double confidence()
                  throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns the confidence level.
        Returns:
        p = 1-alpha
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if no confidence level has been given and hence no confidence interval could be computed

      • windowQuery

        public double windowQuery(Object left,
                          Object right)
        Returns the difference F(b) - F(a). The implementation of this method is not based on the eval-method. The difference will be directly evaluated by
         
                int size = sample.length;
                for ( int i=0; i< size; i++){
                        double xi = ((Number) sample[i]).doubleValue();
                        if (( xi <= b) && ( xi > a)) r++;
                }
                return (double) r / (double) size;
        Specified by:
        windowQuery in interface WindowQuery
        Parameters:
        left - left border of the window query
        right - right border of the window query
        Returns:
        the difference F(b) - F(a) respectively F(right) - F(left)
